Name: Atlantida
Description: A coastal region known for its beautiful beaches, national parks, and the Garífuna culture.

Name: Choluteca
Description: Located in the south of the country, this region is known for its agricultural production and warm climate.

Name: Colon
Description: A region located on the Caribbean coast, famous for its natural resources and proximity to the border with Nicaragua.

Name: Cortes
Description: The most industrialized region of Honduras, with its capital city San Pedro Sula being the country s second-largest city.

Name: El Paraiso
Description: Known for its agricultural industry, particularly coffee and sugar, and its proximity to Nicaragua.

Name: Francisco Morazán
Description: This region contains the capital city, Tegucigalpa, the political and economic center of Honduras.

Name: Gracias a Dios
Description: A remote and less developed region known for its indigenous communities, lush forests, and coastal areas.

Name: Intibucá
Description: A small, mountainous region in the central part of Honduras, known for its indigenous cultures and handicrafts.

Name: Islas de la Bahía
Description: A famous island region located in the Caribbean Sea, known for its tourism, including Roatán, Utila, and Guanaja.

Name: Lempira
Description: Located in the western part of the country, known for its mountainous terrain and indigenous cultures.

Name: Ocotepeque
Description: A border region with Guatemala, known for its natural beauty, mountains, and farming communities.

Name: Olancho
Description: The largest region in Honduras by area, known for its extensive forests, rivers, and agricultural activities.

Name: Santa Barbara
Description: A region known for its agricultural activities, particularly coffee production, and its mountainous terrain.

Name: Valle
Description: A small region known for its agricultural output, particularly sugarcane and livestock farming.
